title:
20c05 - Employees
of hatchery who "cull" poultry on farms.
text:
An
employee who is part of a crew employed by a hatchery to test poultry raised by
poultry farmers, for the purpose of eliminating diseased fowls, is not an
"outside buyer" within the meaning of Sec 13(b)(5), even though the
hatchery reimburses the poultry farmer for the loss of the culled fowls. These
employees are not primarily employed as buyers. Their primary purpose is to
dispose of the culled poultry so that the flock will not be adversely affected.
This particular activity, however, may be exempt under Sec 13(a)(6).
html: An employee who is part of a crew employed by a hatchery to test poultry raised by poultry farmers, for the purpose of eliminating diseased fowls, is not an "outside buyer" within the meaning of Sec 13(b)(5), even though the hatchery reimburses the poultry farmer for the loss of the culled fowls. These employees are not primarily employed as buyers. Their primary purpose is to dispose of the culled poultry so that the flock will not be adversely affected. This particular activity, however, may be exempt under Sec 13(a)(6).
